data.chText: 身体部位
data.enText: part of body

data.chText: 心；心脏
data.enText: the organ in the chest that sends blood around the body, usually on the left in humans

data.chText: 病人的心跳停顿了几秒钟。
data.enText: The patient's heart stopped beating for a few seconds.

data.chText: 心脏病；心力衰竭
data.enText: heart trouble/failure

data.chText: 心脏不好
data.enText: to have a weak heart

data.chText: 我能感觉到我的心在胸腔里剧烈地跳动着。
data.enText: I could feel my heart pounding in my chest (= because of excitement etc.) .

data.chText: 胸部心脏的部位
data.enText: the outside part of the chest where the heart is

data.chText: 她把相片紧紧地抱在怀里。
data.enText: She clasped the photo to her heart.

data.chText: 感情；心情
data.enText: feelings/emotions

data.chText: 内心；心肠；（尤指）爱心
data.enText: the place in a person where the feelings and emotions are thought to be, especially those connected with love

data.chText: 她有一颗善良的心。
data.enText: She has a kind heart.

data.chText: 你没有一点同情心吗？
data.enText: Have you no heart?

data.chText: 他心情沉重地回来了。
data.enText: He returned with a heavy heart (= sad) .

data.chText: 她的小说往往是有关爱情故事的。
data.enText: Her novels tend to deal with affairs of the heart .

data.chText: 这部小说准确地传达了一代人的感情和思想。
data.enText: The story captured the hearts and minds of a generation.

data.chText: 有…心
data.enText: -hearted

data.chText: 有…性格（或品格）的
data.enText: having the type of character or personality mentioned

data.chText: 冷酷无情
data.enText: cold-hearted

data.chText: 好心肠
data.enText: kind-hearted

data.chText: 重要部分
data.enText: important part

data.chText: 重点；核心；要点
data.enText: the most important part of sth

data.chText: 事情 / 问题的核心
data.enText: the heart of the matter/problem

data.chText: 委员会的报告直指政府窘境的实质。
data.enText: The committee's report went to the heart of the government's dilemma.

data.chText: 是非界限是所有道德问题的核心。
data.enText: The distinction between right and wrong lies at the heart of all questions of morality.

data.chText: 中心
data.enText: centre

data.chText: 中心；中央
data.enText: the part that is in the centre of sth

data.chText: 一家位于市中心的安静的旅馆
data.enText: a quiet hotel in the very heart of the city

data.chText: 卷心菜
data.enText: of cabbage

data.chText: 菜心
data.enText: the smaller leaves in the middle of a cabbage , lettuce , etc.

data.chText: 形状
data.enText: shape

data.chText: 心形物；（常指象征爱的）红心
data.enText: a thing shaped like a heart , often red and used as a symbol of love

data.chText: “我爱你”这几个字写在一个大红心里。
data.enText: The words ‘I love you’ were written inside a big red heart.

data.chText: 纸牌游戏
data.enText: in card games

data.chText: （统称）红桃牌，红心牌
data.enText: one of the four sets of cards (called suits ) in a pack/deck of cards, with red heart symbols on them

data.chText: 红桃王后
data.enText: the queen of hearts

data.chText: 红桃是主。
data.enText: Hearts is/are trumps.

data.chText: （一张）红桃牌，红心牌
data.enText: one card from the set of hearts

data.chText: 谁打出的那张红桃？
data.enText: Who played that heart?
at heart

data.chText: 内心里；本质上
data.enText: used to say what sb is really like even though they may seem to be sth different

data.chText: 他本质上还是个社会主义者。
data.enText: He's still a socialist at heart.
break sb's heart

data.chText: 使某人很难过；使心碎
data.enText: to make sb feel very unhappy

data.chText: 她取消婚约使他为之心碎。
data.enText: She broke his heart when she called off the engagement.

data.chText: 看到你这个样子我很难过。
data.enText: It breaks my heart to see you like this.
by heart
off by heart

data.chText: 单凭记忆；能背诵
data.enText: using only your memory

data.chText: 这个号码我拨了很多次，都记住了。
data.enText: I've dialled the number so many times I know it by heart.

data.chText: 她把整篇讲话都背熟了。
data.enText: She's learnt the whole speech off by heart.
close/dear/near to sb's heart

data.chText: 为某人所重视关心；为某人所爱
data.enText: having a lot of importance and interest for sb
from the (bottom of your) heart

data.chText: 真诚地；从内心（深处）
data.enText: in a way that is sincere

data.chText: 我诚心诚意地恳求你饶他一命吧。
data.enText: I beg you, from the bottom of my heart, to spare his life.

data.chText: 那很明显是由衷的提议。
data.enText: It was clearly an offer that came from the heart.
give sb (fresh) heart

data.chText: 激励某人；使某人振作
data.enText: to make sb feel positive, especially when they thought that they had no chance of achieving sth
give your heart to sb

data.chText: 爱上某人；倾心
data.enText: to give your love to one person
have a heart!

data.chText: 发发善心吧；讲点情理吧
data.enText: used to ask sb to be kind and/or reasonable
have a heart of gold

data.chText: 有金子般的心；心肠很好
data.enText: to be a very kind person
have a heart of stone

data.chText: 铁石心肠；冷酷无情
data.enText: to be a person who does not show others sympathy or pity
heart and soul

data.chText: 满腔热忱干劲十足；全心全意
data.enText: with a lot of energy and enthusiasm

data.chText: 他们全心全意地投入了这个项目。
data.enText: They threw themselves heart and soul into the project.
your heart goes out to sb

data.chText: 十分同情；怜悯
data.enText: used to say that you feel a lot of sympathy for sb

data.chText: 我们很同情那些受害者的家人。
data.enText: Our hearts go out to the families of the victims.
sb's heart is in their mouth

data.chText: 提心吊胆；心提到了嗓子眼儿
data.enText: somebody feels nervous or frightened about sth
sb's heart is in the right place

data.chText: 本意是好的；心眼是好的
data.enText: used to say that sb's intentions are kind and sincere even though they sometimes do the wrong thing
your heart is not in sth

data.chText: 对某事不很感兴趣（或不热衷）
data.enText: used to say that you are not very interested in or enthusiastic about sth
sb's heart leaps

data.chText: 心花怒放
data.enText: used to say that sb has a sudden feeling of happiness or excitement
sb's heart misses a beat

data.chText: 心里咯噔一下（表示突然感到恐惧、兴奋等）
data.enText: used to say that sb has a sudden feeling of fear, excitement, etc.
sb's heart sinks

data.chText: 心里一沉（表示突然感到悲伤或沮丧）
data.enText: used to say that sb suddenly feels sad or depressed about sth

data.chText: 我看到还有那么多活没干时，心顿时沉了下去。
data.enText: My heart sank when I saw how much work there was left.

data.chText: 她心情沉重地看着他走了。
data.enText: She watched him go with a sinking heart .
in good heart

data.chText: 心情舒畅；兴高采烈
data.enText: happy and cheerful
in your heart (of hearts)

data.chText: 在内心深处；内心强烈地感觉到
data.enText: if you know sth in your heart , you have a strong feeling that it is true

data.chText: 她心底里明白她在作出错误的决定。
data.enText: She knew in her heart of hearts that she was making the wrong decision.
it does sb's heart good (to do sth)

data.chText: （看到或听到某事时）使人感到高兴，使人心旷神怡
data.enText: it makes sb feel happy when they see or hear sth

data.chText: 看到故居被照管得这么好，真叫人高兴。
data.enText: It does my heart good to see the old place being taken care of so well.
let your heart rule your head

data.chText: 感情用事
data.enText: to act according to what you feel rather than to what you think is sensible
lose heart

data.chText: 丧失信心；泄气
data.enText: to stop hoping for sth or trying to do sth because you no longer feel confident
lose your heart (to sb/sth)

data.chText: 爱上（某人 / 事物）
data.enText: to fall in love with sb/sth
a man/woman after your own heart

data.chText: 趣味相投者；情投意合者
data.enText: a man/woman who likes the same things or has the same opinions as you
my heart bleeds (for sb)

data.chText: （表示不同情或不怜悯）真可怜
data.enText: used to say that you do not feel sympathy or pity for sb

data.chText: “我要出差去巴西。”“真够可怜的！”
data.enText: ‘I have to go to Brazil on business.’ ‘My heart bleeds for you!’
not have the heart (to do sth)

data.chText: 不忍心（做某事）
data.enText: to be unable to do sth because you know that it will make sb sad or upset
pour out/open your heart to sb

data.chText: 向某人敞开心扉；倾诉衷肠
data.enText: to tell sb all your problems, feelings, etc.
set your heart on sth
have your heart set on sth

data.chText: 渴望；一心想要
data.enText: to want sth very much
take heart (from sth)

data.chText: （由于某事）增强信心；重新振作起来
data.enText: to feel more positive about sth, especially when you thought that you had no chance of achieving sth

data.chText: 政府可以从最近的民意测验中找回信心。
data.enText: The government can take heart from the latest opinion polls.
take sth to heart

data.chText: 对某事感到烦恼；十分介意（某人的话或行为）；耿耿于怀
data.enText: to be very upset by sth that sb says or does
tear/rip the heart out of sth

data.chText: 摧毁…的核心
data.enText: to destroy the most important part or aspect of sth
to your heart's content

data.chText: 尽情地；心满意足
data.enText: as much as you want

data.chText: 一处能让孩子们尽情游玩且有人看管的地方
data.enText: a supervised play area where children can run around to their heart's content
with all your heart/your whole heart

data.chText: 完全地；全心全意
data.enText: completely

data.chText: 我衷心希望你一切顺利。
data.enText: I hope with all my heart that things work out for you.
absence makes the heart grow fonder

data.chText: 不相见，倍思念
data.enText: used to say that when you are away from sb that you love, you love them even more
a change of heart

data.chText: 改变态度，改变看法（通常指变得更友好、有益等）
data.enText: if you have a change of heart , your attitude towards sth changes, usually making you feel more friendly, helpful, etc.
cross my heart (and hope to die)

data.chText: 我发誓（否则不得好死）
data.enText: used to emphasize that you are telling the truth or will do what you promise

data.chText: 我看见是他干的，我可以发誓。
data.enText: I saw him do it─cross my heart.
be etched on your heart/memory/mind

data.chText: 铭记在心；永志不忘；牢记心头
data.enText: if sth is etched on your memory, you remember it because it has made a strong impression on you
what the eye doesn't see (the heart doesn't grieve over)

data.chText: 眼不见（心不烦）；眼不见为净
data.enText: if a person does not know about sth that they would normally disapprove of, then it cannot hurt them

data.chText: 我趁他外出时用他的公寓有什么关系呢？反正他又看不见！
data.enText: What does it matter if I use his flat while he's away? What the eye doesn't see…!
find it in your heart/yourself to do sth

data.chText: 能做某事；愿意干某事
data.enText: to be able or willing to do sth

data.chText: 你能够做到宽恕她吗？
data.enText: Can you find it in your heart to forgive her?

data.chText: 他再也不愿意相信任何人了。
data.enText: He couldn't find it in himself to trust anyone again.
out of the goodness of your heart

data.chText: 出于（利他主义）好心
data.enText: from feelings of kindness, without thinking about what advantage there will be for you

data.chText: 你该不是说他是纯粹出于好心主动借钱给你的吧？
data.enText: You're not telling me he offered to lend you the money out of the goodness of his heart?
home is where the heart is

data.chText: 家乃心之所系
data.enText: a home is where the people you love are
have sb's interests at heart

data.chText: 关心…的幸福成功；暗暗地替…着想
data.enText: to want sb to be happy and successful even though your actions may not show this
sick at heart

data.chText: 十分不快；非常失望
data.enText: very unhappy or disappointed
sob your heart out

data.chText: 悲切地哭泣；很伤心地哭泣
data.enText: to cry noisily for a long time because you are very sad
steal sb's heart

data.chText: 博得某人的欢心
data.enText: to make sb fall in love with you
strike fear, etc. into sb/sb's heart

data.chText: 使某人感到恐惧等
data.enText: to make sb be afraid, etc.
tear at your heart
tear your heart out

data.chText: 使伤心；使心如刀绞；使愁肠寸断
data.enText: to strongly affect you in an emotional way
warm the cockles (of sb's heart)

data.chText: 使人内心感到高兴（或同情）
data.enText: to make sb feel happy or sympathetic
the way to sb's heart

data.chText: 赢得某人喜爱的办法；攻心策
data.enText: the way to make sb like or love you

data.chText: 取得男人欢心的方法就是让他吃好。
data.enText: The way to a man's heart is through his stomach (= by giving him good food) .
wear your heart on your sleeve

data.chText: 让感情外露；把心事挂在脸上
data.enText: to allow your feelings to be seen by other people
win sb's heart

data.chText: 赢得（某人）的爱
data.enText: to make sb love you
young at heart

data.chText: 人老心不老
data.enText: thinking and behaving like a young person even when you are old

ex.chText: 会议室中央有一张巨大的橡木桌子。
ex.enText: There is a huge oak table in the centre of the meeting room.

ex.chText: 北京是中国的政治和文化中心。
ex.enText: Beijing is the political and cultural centre of China.

synonyms.bx: 指空间、地域或物体的中心点，也可指学术、商业等活动的中心。

ex.chText: 去除果核，把苹果切成薄片。
ex.enText: Remove the cores, and thinly slice the apples.

ex.chText: 他们吁求的核心是言论自由。
ex.enText: The core of their appeal is freedom of speech.
Debt is at the core of the problem.

synonyms.bx: 指某物体的中心部分或某事物最重要的部分。

ex.chText: 我们必须抓住问题的核心。
ex.enText: We must get to the heart of the issue.

ex.chText: 他们去了市中心的一家大酒店。
ex.enText: They went to a big hotel in the heart/centre of the city.

synonyms.bx: 指事物最重要的部分；也可指方位上的中心，作此义解时可与 centre 换用。

ex.enText: There is a table in the middle of the parlor.
He came back home in the middle of the night.

synonyms.bx: 指空间、时间或事件的中间部分。

ex.chText: 我们在他的一群老朋友中找到了他。
ex.enText: We found him in the midst of a group of his usual friends.

ex.chText: 我在工作中趁隙休息了一个钟头。
ex.enText: In the midst of my work I snatched an hour's rest.

synonyms.bx: 指位于某地的中部或者处于一群人、一堆物品中间，也可指在某事的进行过程中。

data.enText: He's still a socialist at heart.

data.enText: to destroy the most important part or aspect of sth
to your heart's content

data.chText: 尽情地；心满意足
data.enText: as much as you want

data.chText: 一处能让孩子们尽情游玩且有人看管的地方
data.enText: a supervised play area where children can run around to their heart's content
with all your heart/your whole heart

data.chText: 完全地；全心全意
data.enText: completely

data.chText: 我衷心希望你一切顺利。
data.enText: I hope with all my heart that things work out for you.
absence makes the heart grow fonder

data.chText: 不相见，倍思念
data.enText: used to say that when you are away from sb that you love, you love them even more
a change of heart

data.chText: 改变态度，改变看法（通常指变得更友好、有益等）
data.enText: if you have a change of heart , your attitude towards sth changes, usually making you feel more friendly, helpful, etc.
cross my heart (and hope to die)

data.chText: 我发誓（否则不得好死）
data.enText: used to emphasize that you are telling the truth or will do what you promise

data.chText: 我看见是他干的，我可以发誓。
data.enText: I saw him do it─cross my heart.
be etched on your heart/memory/mind

data.chText: 铭记在心；永志不忘；牢记心头
data.enText: if sth is etched on your memory, you remember it because it has made a strong impression on you
what the eye doesn't see (the heart doesn't grieve over)

data.chText: 眼不见（心不烦）；眼不见为净
data.enText: if a person does not know about sth that they would normally disapprove of, then it cannot hurt them

data.chText: 我趁他外出时用他的公寓有什么关系呢？反正他又看不见！
data.enText: What does it matter if I use his flat while he's away? What the eye doesn't see…!
find it in your heart/yourself to do sth

data.chText: 能做某事；愿意干某事
data.enText: to be able or willing to do sth

data.chText: 你能够做到宽恕她吗？
data.enText: Can you find it in your heart to forgive her?

data.chText: 他再也不愿意相信任何人了。
data.enText: He couldn't find it in himself to trust anyone again.
out of the goodness of your heart

data.chText: 出于（利他主义）好心
data.enText: from feelings of kindness, without thinking about what advantage there will be for you

data.chText: 你该不是说他是纯粹出于好心主动借钱给你的吧？
data.enText: You're not telling me he offered to lend you the money out of the goodness of his heart?
home is where the heart is

data.chText: 家乃心之所系
data.enText: a home is where the people you love are
have sb's interests at heart

data.chText: 关心…的幸福成功；暗暗地替…着想
data.enText: to want sb to be happy and successful even though your actions may not show this
sick at heart

data.chText: 十分不快；非常失望
data.enText: very unhappy or disappointed
sob your heart out

data.chText: 悲切地哭泣；很伤心地哭泣
data.enText: to cry noisily for a long time because you are very sad
steal sb's heart

data.chText: 博得某人的欢心
data.enText: to make sb fall in love with you
strike fear, etc. into sb/sb's heart

data.chText: 使某人感到恐惧等
data.enText: to make sb be afraid, etc.
tear at your heart
tear your heart out

data.chText: 使伤心；使心如刀绞；使愁肠寸断
data.enText: to strongly affect you in an emotional way
warm the cockles (of sb's heart)

data.chText: 使人内心感到高兴（或同情）
data.enText: to make sb feel happy or sympathetic
the way to sb's heart

data.chText: 赢得某人喜爱的办法；攻心策
data.enText: the way to make sb like or love you

data.chText: 取得男人欢心的方法就是让他吃好。
data.enText: The way to a man's heart is through his stomach (= by giving him good food) .
wear your heart on your sleeve

data.chText: 让感情外露；把心事挂在脸上
data.enText: to allow your feelings to be seen by other people
win sb's heart

data.chText: 赢得（某人）的爱
data.enText: to make sb love you
young at heart

data.chText: 人老心不老
data.enText: thinking and behaving like a young person even when you are old

tr: a playing card in the major suit that has one or more red hearts on it
example: he led the queen of hearts

tr: an inclination or tendency of a certain kind
example: he had a change of heart
he kept fighting on pure spunk
you haven't got the heart for baseball

tr: the hollow muscular organ located behind the sternum and between the lungs
its rhythmic contractions move the blood through the body
example: he stood still, his heart thumping wildly

tr: the locus of feelings and intuitions
example: in your heart you know it is true
her story would melt your bosom

tr: the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience
example: the gist of the prosecutor's argument
the heart and soul of the Republican Party
he had trouble expressing the affection he felt
the warmness of his welcome made us feel right at home

tr: a firm rather dry variety meat (usually beef or veal)
example: a five-pound beef heart will serve six

tr: an area that is approximately central within some larger region
example: it is in the center of town
they ran forward into the heart of the struggle
they were in the eye of the storm

tr: a plane figure with rounded sides curving inward at the top and intersecting at the bottom
conventionally used on playing cards and valentines
example: he drew a heart and called it a valentine

value.def: Your heart is the organ in your chest that pumps the blood around your body. People also use heart to refer to the area of their chest that is closest to their heart.

example.ex: The bullet had passed less than an inch from Andrea's heart...
example.tran: 子弹在离安德烈亚的心脏不到一英寸的地方穿过。

example.ex: The only sound inside was the beating of his heart...
example.tran: 屋内唯一的声音就是他的心跳声。

example.ex: He gave a sudden cry of pain and put his hand to his heart.
example.tran: 他突然痛苦地大叫一声，用手捂住了心口。

value.def: You can refer to someone's heart when you are talking about their deep feelings and beliefs.

example.ex: Alik's words filled her heart with pride...
example.tran: 亚利克的话让她心感自豪。

example.ex: I just couldn't bring myself to admit what I knew in my heart to be true.
example.tran: 我就是无法迫使自己承认心里知道的事实。

value.def: You use heart when you are talking about someone's character and attitude towards other people, especially when they are kind and generous.

example.ex: She loved his brilliance and his generous heart...
example.tran: 她深爱他的才华横溢和古道热肠。

example.ex: She's got a good heart but she's calculating.
example.tran: 她心地善良，但却工于心计。

value.def: If you refer to things of the heart, you mean love and relationships.

example.ex: This is an excellent time for affairs of the heart.
example.tran: 这是谈情说爱的绝佳时机。

value.def: The heart of something is the most central and important part of it.

example.ex: The heart of the problem is supply and demand...
example.tran: 问题的核心是供求关系。

example.ex: Money lies at the heart of the debate over airline safety.
example.tran: 资金是空运安全争论中的实质问题。

value.def: The heart of a place is its centre.

example.ex: ...a busy dentists' practice in the heart of London's West End.
example.tran: 位于伦敦西区中心的一个繁忙的牙科诊所

value.def: The heart of a lettuce, cabbage, or other vegetable is its centre leaves.
A heart is a shape that is used as a symbol of love: ♥.

example.ex: ...heart-shaped chocolates.
example.tran: 心形巧克力

value.def: Hearts is one of the four suits in a pack of playing cards. Each card in the suit is marked with one or more red symbols in the shape of a heart.

posc.def: A heart is a playing card of this suit.

example.ex: West had to decide whether to play a heart.
example.tran: 韦斯特必须决定是否要出一张红桃。

value.def: If you feel or believe something with all your heart, you feel or believe it very strongly.

example.ex: My own family I loved with all my heart.
example.tran: 我真心实意地爱我全家人。

gramarinfo.label: PHR after v, PHR with cl

value.tran: 全心全意地;真心实意地

value.def: If you say that someone is a particular kind of person at heart, you mean that that is what they are really like, even though they may seem very different.

example.ex: He was a very gentle boy at heart.
example.tran: 他实际上是个非常温柔的男生。

value.def: If you say that someone has your interests or your welfare at heart, you mean that they are concerned about you and that is why they are doing something.

example.ex: She told him she only had his interests at heart.
example.tran: 她告诉他自己万事都是为了他好。

value.tran: 十分关心（某人的利益或福祉）

value.def: If someone breaks your heart, they make you very sad and unhappy, usually because they end a love affair or close relationship with you.
value.tran: （通常指因感情破裂而）使…伤心，使…心碎

value.def: If something breaks your heart, it makes you feel very sad and depressed, especially because people are suffering but you can do nothing to help them.

example.ex: It really breaks my heart to see them this way.
example.tran: 看到他们这个样子可真让我伤心。

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, oft PHR to-inf

value.tran: （尤指因对他人的苦难无能为力而）使…伤心，使…心碎

value.def: If you say that someone has a broken heart, you mean that they are very sad, for example because a love affair has ended unhappily.

example.ex: She never recovered from her broken heart.
example.tran: 她心上的伤再也没能愈合。

value.def: If you know something such as a poem by heart, you have learned it so well that you can remember it without having to read it.

example.ex: Mack knew this passage by heart.
example.tran: 麦克会背这一段。

value.def: If someone has a change of heart, their attitude towards something changes.

example.ex: Several brokers have had a change of heart about prospects for the company...
example.tran: 几位经纪人对该公司前景的看法已经有所改变。

example.ex: Why the change of heart?
example.tran: 为什么变了态度？

value.def: If something such as a subject or project is close to your heart or near to your heart, it is very important to you and you are very interested in it and concerned about it.

example.ex: Animal welfare is a subject very close to my heart.
example.tran: 动物福利是我非常关注的一个问题。

value.def: If you can do something to your heart's content, you can do it as much as you want.

example.ex: I was delighted to be able to eat my favorite dishes to my heart's content.
example.tran: 我很高兴能够痛痛快快地吃我最喜爱的菜。

value.def: You can say 'cross my heart' when you want someone to believe that you are telling the truth. You can also ask 'cross your heart?', when you are asking someone if they are really telling the truth.

example.ex: And I won't tell any of the other girls anything you tell me about it. I promise, cross my heart.
example.tran: 我不会把你告诉我的事告诉任何其他女孩。我发誓，保证不会。

value.tran: 我发誓（所说的是真的）/你敢发誓（所说的是真的）吗？

value.def: If you say something from the heart or from the bottom of your heart, you sincerely mean what you say.

example.ex: He spoke with confidence, from the heart...
example.tran: 他的话充满信心，发自心坎。

example.ex: I don't want to go away without thanking you from the bottom of my heart.
example.tran: 我离开之前一定要先衷心地感谢你。

value.def: If something gives you heart, it makes you feel more confident or happy about something.

example.ex: It gave me heart to see one thug get what he deserves.
example.tran: 看到一个恶棍罪有应得真是大快我心。

value.def: If you want to do something but do not have the heart to do it, you do not do it because you know it will make someone unhappy or disappointed.

example.ex: We knew all along but didn'thave the heart to tell her.
example.tran: 我们一直都知道，但却不忍心告诉她。

value.def: If you believe or know something in your heart of hearts, that is what you really believe or think, even though it may sometimes seem that you do not.

example.ex: I know in my heart of hearts that I am the right man for that mission.
example.tran: 我心里深知我是完成那项任务的合适人选。

gramarinfo.label: PHR after v, PHR with cl

value.def: If your heart isn't in the thing you are doing, you have very little enthusiasm for it, usually because you are depressed or are thinking about something else.

example.ex: I tried to learn some lines but my heart wasn't really in it.
example.tran: 我想要背几句台词，但我的心根本不在那上面。

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, PHR n/-ing

value.def: If you lose heart, you become sad and depressed and are no longer interested in something, especially because it is not progressing as you would like.

example.ex: He appealed to his countrymen not to lose heart.
example.tran: 他呼吁自己的同胞不要丧失信心。

value.def: If you lose your heart to someone, you fall in love with them.

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, oft PHR <l>to</l> n

value.def: If your heart is in your mouth, you feel very excited, worried, or frightened.

example.ex: My heart was in my mouth when I walked into her office.
example.tran: 我走进她的办公室时，紧张得心都到了喉咙口。

value.tran: 激动非常;焦急万分;害怕得要命

value.def: If you open your heart or pour out your heart to someone, you tell them your most private thoughts and feelings.

example.ex: She opened her heart to millions yesterday and told how she came close to suicide.
example.tran: 她昨天在数成百万人面前倾吐心声，讲述了自己是如何差点轻生的。

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, usu PHR <l>to</l> n

value.def: If you say that someone's heart is in the right place, you mean that they are kind, considerate, and generous, although you may disapprove of other aspects of their character.

example.ex: He is a bit of a tearaway but his heart is in the right place.
example.tran: 他是有点像个阿飞，但心眼儿不错。

value.tran: （尽管有其他缺点但）心地善良，心眼儿好

value.def: If you have set your heart on something, you want it very much or want to do it very much.

example.ex: He had always set his heart on a career in the fine arts.
example.tran: 他一直以来都一心想把美术作为自己的事业。

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, PHR n/-ing

value.tran: 一心想要得到;一心想要做

value.def: If you wear your heart on your sleeve, you openly show your feelings or emotions rather than keeping them hidden.
If you put your heart and soul into something, you do it with a great deal of enthusiasm and energy.

example.ex: He will always be successful when he puts his mind to something, because he puts his heart and soul into it.
example.tran: 当他专心想干某件事时，他总是能成功，因为他会全心全意地投入其中。

value.tran: 全心全意地;尽心尽力地

value.def: If you take heart from something, you are encouraged and made to feel optimistic by it.
If you take something to heart, for example someone's behaviour, you are deeply affected and upset by it.

example.ex: If someone says something critical I take it to heart.
example.tran: 如果有人提出批评，我会十分介意。

value.tran: 对…耿耿于怀;为…感到不快

trans: 全心全意， 完全地；一心
内心深处；十分关心（某人的利益或福祉）；（人）本质上，实际上，内心里
关键；位于；在……的中心；核心
充血性心脏衰竭；心力衰竭；心衰；充血性心力衰竭；充血性心衰
